page.title: 12Health
page.content: There is no doctor ,nurse ,dentist or hospital in Bassenthwaite. The nearest are about 7 miles away. Bassenthwaite gets its water from Hausegill. The water from Hausebeck runs down onto the filter beds. The filters are controlled by ball cocks. There are gabions there to block the water from coming into the filter beds when there is a storm. In the filter beds are layers of sand, gravel and stone. The sand is washed once in a fortnight. They add chlorine to the water to keep out the germs. Pumps are not needed because it goes down hill all the way. At Hausegill there is an alarm which rings when anything goes wrong. Hausebeck runs into Dashbeck which runs through Bassenthwaite Village as Halls Beck.
